answers.answer: One aspirin a day  calcium and blood pressure meds...a lot of swelling n very frequent ultrasounds

I had it.. I had high bp and my doc sent me to l&d to get checked and they told me I had to stay and delivered the baby because there was no way I was leaving the hospital and still pregnant there they told me I had preeclamsia ... I was 35 weeks & 6 days when my baby was born shes now 2 months and perfectly healthy shes doing really good alot of people tell me she doesnt look like she was born early ...

Btw I was also really swollen my feets and ankles were huge and it was getting worse even my legs were getting swollen it hurt alot I couldnt fit in to any shoes ... so swelling and high pb was what sent me to l&d
Im on aspirin from keeping me getting preeclasmia
You shouldn't take aspirin. Its a blood thinner so you will be more likely to hemorrhage after baby is born.  Thats what happened to my mom.
Did your baby had to go to NICU im a ftm and they already gave me steroid shots for her to help with her lungs.  That was at 29 weeks.. im 32 weeks now

question: Does Anyone else have this? I dont wanna be the only one.. how are you feeling?  Are you taking any meds?
title: Preeclampsia
